quest.name: A Keyward's Gaol
journal: Erichthonios is resolutely avoiding his father's eye.

At his son's prompting, a surprisingly cooperative Lahabrea explains that Hephaistos was an experiment born of his own negative emotions, meant to remain sealed away forevermore. While he does not know how his so-called “other half” came to roam the facility unfettered, he concludes that the best means to keep him from wreaking further havoc is to destroy Pandæmonium before the barriers surrounding it are undone. Following Erichthonios's stringent objection to this course, Themis invokes his position as Emissary to advocate for continued investigation of the facility, that the warders might yet be saved. Lahabrea begrudgingly accepts this decision, but states that he will not hesitate to move forward with Pandæmonium's erasure if you are unequal to the task. Angered by his father's callousness, Erichthonios stalks off.

You approach Erichthonios at a remove from the entrance to Abyssos. He appears to have calmed down somewhat, and even admits that Lahabrea's knowledge will prove useful as you venture into Abyssos. He asks that you speak to Lahabrea in his stead, as it seems the chief keyward has a special interest in you.

Although Lahabrea can no longer directly control Abyssos, he can yet sense the aether within. He informs you that while no creations have been set loose, the keyward Hegemone awaits your arrival. Traces of her original self remain, but corruption indicates the likelihood that she has already been transformed into a hemitheos. You brace yourself for the battle ahead, and hope that the keyward is not yet too far gone to be saved.

※Abyssos: The Sixth Circle can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

You find the keyward Hegemone either unable or unwilling to listen to reason─though that appears to be the least of her problems. After a skin-crawling struggle with her and the parasite stitched into her flesh, your phantom party attains victory, sealing the keyward away in the hopes that the harm done to her can be reversed in the future.

With your goal attained, Erichthonios is convinced that Lahabrea can no longer deny your strength and resolve. Yet the stygian depths of Pandæmonium await, halls echoing with the cries of Hephaistos's damned...

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: I see Elidibus has chosen to keep odd company. Such a vexing composition of aether you possess...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I admit my own grasp on what just occurred is somewhat tenuous. Doubtless Lahabrea can elucidate matters for us...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I don't know how long it's been since we last spoke, Lahabrea, and truth be told I had hoped we never would again.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: But I see now that I was a fool to think I would ever escape your meddling. Just what is that...thing that called himself Lahabrea? And why is he the spitting image of your younger self?

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I find it hard to believe you've only just now found out such a being was wreaking havoc in Pandæmonium. Did you think matters would simply sort themselves out?

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: ...Hmph. I suppose you deserve at least a cursory explanation.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: I was well aware of the anomalies occurring within Pandæmonium, including the fact that Azem and Elidibus had taken it upon themselves to investigate. I saw no reason to insert myself into the situation. For a time, that was...

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Imagine my surprise when instead of a formal report from you and yours, I received a communication from one of the keywards stating that research and operations were proceeding as usual.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: While Hephaistos's deception was almost childish in its simplicity, it became plain to me that your grasp on the situation was slipping.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: So you knew of his existence from the beginning?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I can hardly imagine that you would suffer another to masquerade as one of the Convocation. Not without good reason, at least.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: As you well know, the name Lahabrea is but a marker of my station. 'Tis not the name I was born with.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Hephaistos has claimed that for himself. I cannot fault him for it, as he is my other half, in a manner of speaking.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: He knows all that I know─my equal in every way. Yet within his heart is naught but greed, envy, and desire. All the emotions that we are loath to acknowledge within ourselves.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: If what you say is true... What purpose would such a being serve?

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: He is the product of experimentation gone awry. A reminder of the days when I was yet young and reckless. I thought him sealed away for good, but it seems time has a way of unearthing the shame we bury.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: When he spoke of my mother, he looked at you with venom in his eyes. Blamed you for her death...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Tell me... Was he right to do so?

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: ...His words were but the ramblings of a tortured mind. The hatred and despair he endures has warped his view of the world irreparably.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: And now that he has awakened, he must be put to rest. If he succeeds in breaching Pandæmonium's protective wards, he shall invite disaster unto our star.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: As chief keyward of Pandæmonium, it is my duty to decide the proper course of action. As such, I declare that all research shall be summarily abandoned and the facility destroyed.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: What? You would leave the other warders to their doom!?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: ...'Tis a choice befitting Lahabrea.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Do you disagree?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: You speak of duty, and ours is to guide our star and its inhabitants upon the correct course. It is no surprise that you would choose annihilation of Pandæmonium if its existence posed even the remotest risk to our people.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Yet as you can see by Erichthonios's response, the decision is somewhat more nuanced than that. Azem and I grappled with this conundrum for some time, in fact.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: That is precisely why I chose to involve myself directly. 'Twas the only way I could truly determine the best solution.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: ...And you need not trouble yourself with that further. The chief keyward must prevent the worst from occurring, no matter the cost. Your feelings, Elidibus, are of no consequence.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Have you taken even a moment to consider another path!? No!

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: You've spared nary a thought for aught but yourself and your duty! You have no idea of the trials we've endured! The foes that Forename has stood against!

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Forename, is it? A being of such aether as I have never seen. What are you?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: SheHe is the guiding star that shall lead us safely through this. Thanks to herhis stout arm and steadfast courage, we have subdued the mythic creations and returned them to their cells.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, I would hear your opinion, Forename. As outsiders, we are in a unique position to look upon circumstances with our vision unclouded by attachment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's too soon to give up on saving the others.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Lahabrea can't be trusted.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: What was that you said about being an emissary?

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Agreed. We still know next to nothing about Hephaistos, and I highly doubt Lahabrea has been forthcoming with the truth.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: But we've managed to regain control of Asphodelos. He must be made to see that there's merit in continuing on this path...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...I have it. Speak in your official capacity as Elidibus the Emissary. Judge which approach is more sound, and even Lahabrea would be compelled to listen.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: That's brilliant! Elidibus the Emissary may speak on our behalf. Should he judge our approach the more sound, even Lahabrea would be compelled to listen.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: As Elidibus, I am duty-bound to assess the matter from a position of impartiality. My opinion as Themis can carry no weight. You understand what that means, yes?

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I do. Even so, you've walked with us all this time─seen what we've seen. Based on that alone, I trust that you'll find the best way forward.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Very well. Then in my capacity as Emissary, I shall state my judgment.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: At present, there are merits both in destroying Pandæmonium outright and in taking time to rescue its researchers. And neither is yet an impossible task.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Therefore, I judge that the most measured choice would be to continue upon our present course. We delve into Abyssos, interring any mythic creations we encounter along the way.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: You have yet to witness Forename's might and Erichthonios's resolve. I would ask that you see our capabilities firsthand, and only then decide if our endeavor is futile.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: If such is the will of the Emissary, then I shall obey. However, if indeed I find your strength to be lacking, I trust there will be no objections to the immediate destruction of Pandæmonium.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: You needn't worry about that─we won't fail.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: You are...bolder than I remember.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...And you're even more tedious than I remember. Forename, come find me when you're finished.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Erichthonios is understandably frustrated, but if we are to conquer Abyssos, we must go forth with clear heads. Pray lend an ear to his troubles, that their weight might be lightened.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: ...You have done all you can with words. Only your actions can convince me now.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Despite recent developments, our plan remains unchanged. Pray call me Themis for the time being─it shall put us all in the correct mindset, and in fact I may be coming to prefer that name.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...You do have my gratitude, ill-fit as I am to show it at the moment. Without your words to sway him, Lahabrea would have carried out his plan without a second thought.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: When at first we realized the creations had slipped their bonds, the other keywards did all in their power to restore order. Even though they could've chosen escape, they remained to aid their allies.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I'm certain not a soul among them would wish to see this facility erased from the world, and they don't deserve to be abandoned simply for carrying out their duty.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: And besides, Hephaistos has secrets yet untold. Secrets that would be buried if Pandæmonium were reduced to rubble. I mean to uncover the truth behind his words...the truth of my mother.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: While Lahabrea was quick to dismiss his claims, I fail to see what Hephaistos would gain by fabricating such a story.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: All I was told of my mother's death was that she perished in an accident. No one would say more─it was almost as if they feared saying more, in fact.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Even if it was not Lahabrea that dealt the fatal blow, we've seen with our own eyes how quickly he can condemn others to die. I only wish to know at last what befell her...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: What do you think, Forename? Does the Lahabrea you know have any regard for the lives of others? Or will he carry out his duty with another's blood on his hands?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He always was a man who worked from the shadows.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: He once used my ally as a vessel for his own twisted ends.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I have no idea what he might be like in this age.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Well, that in and of itself isn't reason for suspicion. He's one of the Convocation, who must forge the path for mankind. Naturally, not all of their activities are conducted within the public eye.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: What would possess him to do that!? Even for Lahabrea, such an act would be a black mark against him if it were made known. I can't imagine how much your ally suffered...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: “This age”? Just how long has it been since last you met? Regardless, I'd like you to try and view him as he is now. Another opinion would be much appreciated...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...But it is plain there is much to consider. Thank you, Forename. It's easy for me to get carried away by emotion where he's concerned.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: We should focus on the task at hand: proving to Lahabrea that we are capable of saving Pandæmonium and its keepers. The most convincing way to do that will be to regain control of Abyssos.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Although I'm loath to admit it, he would know more about those depths than any of us. And seeing as how we require every advantage we can afford...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Forename, would you speak to him for us? He seems to have a special interest in your capabilities, and may deign to help at your suggestion─if only to see what you can do.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Researchers of different layers seldom contact one another unless work is involved, and I know next to nothing about the keyward of Abyssos. Any morsels of information Lahabrea can offer would be a boon.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Erichthonios appears to have a deep trust in you. And Elidibus tells me you share some relation to Azem.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Your unusual aether does not mark you as a familiar. It is unlike anything I have seen, even among the countless concepts I have observed.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: To think that I would encounter an existence I could not create by my own hand. Azem never ceases to surprise.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: The previous Azem was much the same. In taking the entirety of the star into consideration, she came to hold dear emotions and people that a more logical mind would have discarded. This made her act in her own self-interest more often than not...

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Just as you and Elidibus have conducted yourselves in this matter. The true danger of Azem's nature is its tendency to infect all those shehe comes into contact with.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Emet–Selch said much the same. Trust that I shall do naught that would violate my duty.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: And yet you so frivolously invoked your authority as Emissary to justify this little excursion. It matters little, however─only your deeds can speak for you now.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: You wish to know more of Abyssos, I take it. Although I no longer have control over many of its functions, I can yet sense what creations lie within.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: The chief keyward's reach is far indeed. Well then, what do we have to look forward to?

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: I sense no creations of note. Perhaps they have been made into fodder for experimentation, or perhaps they have been transferred to the deeper circles.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Yet Hephaistos would never allow you safe passage. He has left a trial for you to overcome.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: I speak of Hegemone, keyward of Abyssos. Although her presence is stained with marks of corruption, it is unmistakable.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: I knew her as a woman gifted in magic and blessed with a highly logical mind. While I can sense those qualities within her still, there is something else at work...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: If I had to hazard a guess, I would say that's because she's already been twisted into a hemitheos. Doubtless against her will...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Forename, Themis, we must rescue her from that cruel fate. And if we cannot, we can at least seal her away until we find a means to undo the damage.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Your allies make you bold, Erichthonios. I very much look forward to seeing how far they carry you.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Now we prove our strength. Only then can we free the other warders and unveil the truth hidden in Pandæmonium's shadows.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: Hegemone was a woman of reason and logic. She would never be swayed by Hephaistos's wretched schemes. I hope she was not made to suffer overmuch...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Let us not change a strategy that has served us so well thus far. Bring Hegemone to heel, Forename, and Erichthonios and I shall inter her when the time is right.

dialogue.name: LAHABREA
dialogue.text: I could sense from here that Hegemone had been contained. The effect of Hephaistos's tinkering is even more dire than I had imagined...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: As is to be expected, Erichthonios appears quite pleased with our victory.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: We've won! The keyward is sealed away, and alive this time!

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Lahabrea can't deny us now!
